channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Push to Fire Lisa Cook Puts Fed Independence on Trial
item.description: The Supreme Court has said the Federal Reserve Board’s independence warrants protection. President Trump’s effort to fire a member will test that comm...

item.title: Prosecutors Fail to Secure Indictment Against Man Who Threw Sandwich at Federal Agent
item.description: It was a sharp rebuke to the prosecutors who were assigned to bring charges against those arrested after President Trump’s deployment of National Guar...

item.title: Brands are loving Taylor Swift's engagement. Do they need to calm down?
item.description: Companies from Pillsbury to Invisalign to Olipop are cheering — and trying to cash in on — the couple's engagement. Experts spoke to NPR about how bra...

item.title: 2 children are dead, 17 people injured in Minneapolis Catholic school shooting
item.description: The shooter fired through the windows of Annunciation Church during Mass on Wednesday, said Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O'Hara. The gunman was foun...

item.title: Greetings from the Negev desert, where traces remain of a vanished ancient civilization
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: Trump, With Tariffs and Threats, Tries to Strong-Arm Nations to Retreat on Climate Goals
item.description: The president has made no secret of his distaste for wind and solar in America. Now he’s taking his fossil fuel agenda overseas.

item.title: FDA Approves Updated Covid Vaccines With New Restrictions
item.description: The agency’s fall recommendations underscore the goals of Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to limit access to the vaccines, which he has long op...

item.title: Colleges see significant drop in international students as fall semester begins
item.description: Delays and increased screenings for visas mean that many students didn't make it to campus on time – and that has some big implications for the econom...

item.title: The latest COVID vaccines come with new FDA limits
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration approved the next round of COVID-19 vaccines, but is restricting them to people at high risk for COVID complications.

item.title: With Fuzzy Racket Bag, Venus Williams Highlights ERL and Other American Labels
item.description: In her return at the U.S. Open, Ms. Williams decided to highlight labels based in the United States. Her shearling racket bag was hard to miss.

item.title: Why Ukraine Is Allowing More Young Men to Leave the Country
item.description: For three years of war, the country has banned young men from leaving the country once they turn 18, prompting an exodus of teenage boys. Now it is ra...

item.title: Denmark Apologizes After Involuntary Birth Control Scandal in Greenland
item.description: For years, Danish doctors inserted intrauterine devices in Greenlandic girls and women without their consent, part of a painful legacy of mistreatment...

item.title: Trump, With Tariffs and Threats, Tries to Strong-Arm Nations to Retreat on Climate Goals
item.description: The president has made no secret of his distaste for wind and solar in America. Now he’s taking his fossil fuel agenda overseas.

item.title: After Blocking U.N. Nuclear Watchdog, Iran Allows Inspectors to Return
item.description: Iran halted cooperation with the agency last month, as experts warned that Tehran might revive efforts to build a nuclear bomb.

item.title: Uncovering the Genes That Let Our Ancestors Walk Upright
item.description: A new study reveals some of the crucial molecular steps on the path to bipedalism.
